company.name: Bastone
company.coreBusiness: Manufacturing of plasticizers and PVC resin for the plastics industry. Bastone produces essential chemical additives and base materials used in polymer applications, serving as a key supplier of compounds for PVC and flexible plastic manufacturing.

userContext.situation: Someone is planning a plumbing, irrigation, drainage, or construction project that requires PVC pipe. They know PVC pipe exists but are confused by the variety of types available (Schedule 40, Schedule 80, CPVC, different colors, different applications). They need to understand what options exist and which one fits their specific needs.
userContext.currentState: Confused by variety of PVC pipe options; uncertain which type to purchase; concerned about making wrong choice that could lead to project failure or safety issues
userContext.desiredState: Understand the main categories of PVC pipe; know the key differences between types; feel confident selecting the right pipe for their specific application; understand basic terminology like 'Schedule' ratings

goldenInsights.insight: Schedule 80 costs 20-50% more but fittings are interchangeable with Schedule 40 - system is only as strong as weakest component
goldenInsights.suggestedUse: Section opener for Schedule comparison - practical money-saving tip

goldenInsights.insight: At 140F (PVC max temp), pressure rating drops to just 22% - a 450 PSI pipe becomes effectively 99 PSI
goldenInsights.suggestedUse: Hook or safety warning - dramatic temperature-pressure relationship

goldenInsights.insight: PVC pipe colors are industry self-standardized with no legal requirement - always check the label, not just color
goldenInsights.suggestedUse: Counter-intuitive finding for visual identification section

controversies: ABS contains BPA while PVC does not - safety debate for drinking water
research.coreThesis: Choosing the right PVC pipe comes down to three questions: What temperature? What pressure? Where installed? Once answered, the right pipe type becomes obvious.
